abstract: A new credit union wants to serve the banking needs of Colorado’s legal marijuana businesses. The only problem? The federal government needs to sign off.
snippet: A new credit union wants to serve the banking needs of Colorado’s legal marijuana businesses. The only problem? The federal government needs to sign off.
lead_paragraph: It was zero degrees in Denver on a late December morning, and the ice-covered streets were mostly empty. Mark Mason, wearing a full-length black coat, green wool hat and sunglasses, sat in a white Buick LaCrosse, eyeing the squat building across the street. It was the local branch of the Federal Reserve Bank.
